snippet: The episode at the Dikwa camp follows a pattern of attacks that the group has carried out since the military began operations against the militants.
abstract: Two girls accepted at Nigerian refugee camp for people escaping Boko Haram detonate concealed bombs, killing 58 people and wounding 78; third girl refuses to set off her bomb after seeing family members in camp, and warns authorities about plans for future attacks.

byline.original: By USAM SADIQ AL-AMIN and DIONNE SEARCEY
byline.contributor: Usam Sadiq Al-Amin reported from Maiduguri, and Dionne Searcey from Dakar, Senegal.

lead_paragraph: The episode at the Dikwa camp follows a pattern of attacks that the group has carried out since the military began operations against the militants.

headline.main: Young Bombers Kill 58 at Nigerian Camp for Those Fleeing Boko Haram
headline.print_headline: Young Bombers Kill 58 at Nigerian Refugee Camp
